text:
A four-year-old girl with Down syndrome, who began her life in a Colombian orphanage has had a remarkable change in fortune after being picked by Target to be a model for a new product in the retailer's children's range. Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants
question: Would the mass of a baseball affect how much force you have to use to pick it up?
answers: Less the mass, less the force applied
It depends on the shape of the baseball

'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

A four-year-old girl with Down syndrome, who began her life in a Colombian orphanage has had a remarkable change in fortune after being picked by Target to be a model for a new product in the retailer's children's range. Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

A four-year-old girl with Down syndrome, who began her life in a Colombian orphanage has had a remarkable change in fortune after being picked by Target to be a model for a new product in the retailer's children's range. Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011

Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants
question: What occurs as particles move within a fluid?
answers: Transfer of energy to objects via waves

'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants
question: If your family took a car trip what information would you need to determine the average speed you traveled?
answers: How many miles you traveled and when you arrived
To determine the cars speed you would need both the distance traveled and the time it took to travel that distance

How many miles did you drive

'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants

text:
A four-year-old girl with Down syndrome, who began her life in a Colombian orphanage has had a remarkable change in fortune after being picked by Target to be a model for a new product in the retailer's children's range. Little Kayella Aschoff, who was adopted by Ted and Jodi from Minnesota in 2011, was hand-picked by the company to be the face of its training pants, after she attended an open casting call in 2014. 'Kayella loves being in front of the camera,' proud mom Jodi told The Mighty. 'She’s quite the ham. When you take a photo though, she has to check it and then says ‘cute picture’ or she’ll tell you to take another one!'
- Kayella Aschoff was adopted by Ted and Jodi, from Minnesota, in 2011
- The couple have adopted another orphaned child with Down syndrome, Leo, who was born in China
- Kayella appears as the face of Target's new training pants
